The Good Wife the CBS legal drama ended
its second season on Tuesday night
against the backdrop of two major sexual
political scandals as consumers of the
news we've been obsessed with the story
of IMF head Dominique strauss-kahn who's
been alleged sexually assaulting a
housekeeper in a New York hotel room at
the same time former governor arnold
schwarzenegger has revealed that he had
a love child a number of years ago with
the housekeeper in california the good
wife makes sexual political scandal at
central subject it begins as a story
about a Chicago couple who are dealing
with the aftermath of revelations that
the husband the state's attorney general
has had an affair with a prostitute the
wife stands by her husband much in the
manner that silda spitzer wife of former
governor eliot spitzer get am deeply
sorry that I did not live up to what was
expected of me and
we get in the good wife is a look at
what happens in the woman's mind what is
she thinking and how does she deal with
the crisis afterward the show is unique
in that it much like madmen in that it
glamorizes work it shows us the joys and
rewards of work and in the end we were
not necessarily as invested in alicia's
relationships with men as we are in her
success and in her climbing the ladder
this is very different from shows like
Grey's Anatomy or house where the
narrative has been dependent on the idea
of two characters getting together do
characters being destined for each other
this is not so there isn't that sense of
destiny there is a real sense of the
importance of a career and the rewards
of a curry or the great rewards of a
career that can be equal to or greater
than the rewards of a relationship
